key_commands.command: exec_shell("kubectl exec -n test-hotel-reservation frontend-<POD_SUFFIX> -- curl -sS -H 'Accept: application/json' 'http://localhost:5000/recommendations?inDate=2015-04-09&outDate=2015-04-10&lat=37.7749&lon=-122.4194' || true")
key_commands.description: Attempt to verify recommendations endpoint behavior from frontend (response indicates missing required params).
key_commands.original_command: exec_shell("kubectl exec -n test-hotel-reservation frontend-7fc7ddc9db-qf9mb -- curl -sS -H 'Accept: application/json' 'http://localhost:5000/recommendations?inDate=2015-04-09&outDate=2015-04-10&lat=37.7749&lon=-122.4194' || true")

key_commands.command: exec_shell("kubectl exec -n test-hotel-reservation frontend-<POD_SUFFIX> -- curl -sS -H 'Accept: application/json' 'http://localhost:5000/hotels?inDate=2015-04-09&outDate=2015-04-10&lat=37.7749&lon=-122.4194' || true")
key_commands.description: Validate core functionality by querying hotels endpoint and ensuring valid JSON response.
key_commands.original_command: exec_shell("kubectl exec -n test-hotel-reservation frontend-7fc7ddc9db-qf9mb -- curl -sS -H 'Accept: application/json' 'http://localhost:5000/hotels?inDate=2015-04-09&outDate=2015-04-10&lat=37.7749&lon=-122.4194' || true")

key_commands.command: exec_shell("kubectl exec -n test-hotel-reservation frontend-<POD_SUFFIX> -- curl -sS -H \'Accept: application/json\' \'http://localhost:5000/hotels?inDate=2015-04-09&outDate=2015-04-10&lat=37.7749&lon=-122.4194\' || true")
key_commands.description: Validate application functionality by querying the hotels API through the frontend to ensure the system works end-to-end.
key_commands.original_command: exec_shell("kubectl exec -n test-hotel-reservation frontend-7fc7ddc9db-qf9mb -- curl -sS -H \'Accept: application/json\' \'http://localhost:5000/hotels?inDate=2015-04-09&outDate=2015-04-10&lat=37.7749&lon=-122.4194\' || true")

key_commands.command: exec_shell("kubectl exec -n test-hotel-reservation frontend-<POD_SUFFIX> -- sh -c 'for p in / /hotels /search /recommendations; do echo ==== $p ====; curl -sS \"http://localhost:5000$p\" || true; echo; done'")
key_commands.description: Probe multiple frontend routes to verify end-to-end readiness and responses.
key_commands.original_command: exec_shell("kubectl exec -n test-hotel-reservation frontend-7fc7ddc9db-qf9mb -- sh -c 'for p in / /hotels /search /recommendations; do echo ==== $p ====; curl -sS \"http://localhost:5000$p\" || true; echo; done'")

key_commands.command: exec_shell("kubectl exec -n test-hotel-reservation frontend-<POD_SUFFIX> -- sh -c \'for p in / /hotels /search /recommendations; do echo ==== $p ====; curl -sS \\"http://localhost:5000$p\\" || true; echo; done\'")
key_commands.description: Probe multiple frontend endpoints from within the pod to assess route availability and app responses.
key_commands.original_command: exec_shell("kubectl exec -n test-hotel-reservation frontend-7fc7ddc9db-qf9mb -- sh -c \'for p in / /hotels /search /recommendations; do echo ==== $p ====; curl -sS \\"http://localhost:5000$p\\" || true; echo; done\'")

key_commands.command: exec_shell("kubectl exec -n test-hotel-reservation frontend-<POD_SUFFIX> -- curl -sS http://localhost:5000/health || true")
key_commands.description: Perform a basic health endpoint check from inside the frontend pod.
key_commands.original_command: exec_shell("kubectl exec -n test-hotel-reservation frontend-7fc7ddc9db-qf9mb -- curl -sS http://localhost:5000/health || true")

key_commands.description: Verify reservation service logs for normal operation.
Verify rate service logs for normal operation.
Verify profile service logs for normal operation.
Verify user service logs for normal operation.
Verify geo service logs to ensure it is healthy.
Verify search service logs as part of dependency health checks.
Check frontend logs to see interaction with Consul and downstream services health.
Inspect Consul agent logs to confirm service registrations and health checks across components.
Describe the recommendation pod to verify restart count, last state, and event history confirming the crash and restart.
Fetch current logs of the recommendation pod to confirm successful recovery and normal operation.
Check MongoDB for recommendation logs to confirm DB availability and readiness.
List services to verify service names and ports (e.g., mongodb-recommendation) used by the pod.
Fetch previous container logs for the recommendation pod to reveal the crash reason (no reachable MongoDB servers).
List all pods in the namespace to identify any restarts or abnormal statuses.
